topics.body:
"@Thanotos Omega":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54f8b97d63687273fbd00c00#post_54f8b97d63687273fbd00c00
The first entry of the brave series was made in 1991, Gaogaigar was just like the rest of the series except slightly more hot blooded. (To say that it was a response to eva is stupid because That's pretty much ignoring the fact that the franchise was going on for about four years prior and it didn't change that much.)

The only real differences is that the main robot is piloted rather than being a transformer and the whole thing is backed up by the organization known as GGG.
topics.author: 5062d6f17f123b3e16001184

topics.body:
"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54f8ba6c6368725dec861f00#post_54f8ba6c6368725dec861f00
The fact that it didn't change would be a reaction, Eva rewrote the entire genre so everything made after it is influenced by it,
topics.author: 509f70a87f123b77eb0004fd

topics.body:
"@Thanotos Omega":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54f8bad663687249c7440a00#post_54f8bad663687249c7440a00
That was officially the most retarded thing I've ever read. (It didn't change so that means it was influenced by EVA.)

Gaogaigar has nothing to do with Evangelion, End of story.
topics.author: 5062d6f17f123b3e16001184

topics.body:
"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54f8bb446368722c398f0300#post_54f8bb446368722c398f0300
That's like saying Bleach/One Piece/Naruto have nothing to do with Dragon Ball,
topics.author: 509f70a87f123b77eb0004fd

topics.body:
"@Thanotos Omega":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54f8bc7163687217a0ba0600#post_54f8bc7163687217a0ba0600
The difference is that all of those came at least a decade after Dragon ball, Gaogaigar came out less than two years after Evangelion.

Drop it before I start calling you unflattering names. (And what little friendship we still have is gone.)
